description_txt: stated on April 10, 2016 in As part of a Philadelphia Inquirer editorial:
quote_txt: If the mayor were really serious about supporting Philly's schoolchildren and handling our city's looming fiscal crisis, he could begin by slashing the size of his own administration, which is already 45 percent larger than his predecessor's and 40 percent more costly.

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2016 in a Tampa Bay Times interview:
quote_txt: In every ethics case that has resulted in a formal sanction, "there's been an investigative subcommittee that's been established first."

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2016 in a press conference announcing new chairman of transit authority:
quote_txt: "The Katy Freeway, or Interstate 10 west of Houston, is the widest freeway in the world, with up to 26 lanes, including frontage road lanes."

description_txt: stated on February 14, 2016 in a television interview:
quote_txt: "Hedge fund managers and others in private equity pay much lower (tax) rates on their income than do truck drivers and teachers and nurses."

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2016 in an event in Port Washington, N.Y.:
quote_txt: "The state that has the highest per capita number of … guns that end up committing crimes in New York come from Vermont."

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2016 in remarks in Dallas at a Democratic National Committee reception:
quote_txt: "Right now, here in Texas, wind power is already cheaper than dirty fossil fuels."

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2016 in a campaign speech:
quote_txt: "The polling shows over and over again that, unlike Donald Trump, that with me as the nominee, we beat Hillary Clinton."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in a conference call with reporters:
quote_txt: Florida’s regulations on the payday lending industry are "stronger than almost any other state."

description_txt: stated on April 3, 2016 in ad paid for by campaign for Ted Cruz:
quote_txt: Says a company that got tax breaks from the state later "laid off 100 Ohioans, even as its CEO cut a half-million-dollar check to Kasich’s super PAC."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in as a candidate in 2016 and as a possible hopeful in 2000:
quote_txt: On banning assault weapons.

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2016 in an interview with the New York Daily News:
quote_txt: "In Malaysia … many of the workers are indentured servants because their passports are taken away when they come into this country and are working in slave-like conditions."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in an interview:
quote_txt: On supporting winner of Democratic primary with her superdelegate vote.

description_txt: stated on April 7, 2016 in an interview on CNN:
quote_txt: "Poll after poll after poll shows me beating Hillary."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • April 11, 2016

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2016 in a post on Medium:
quote_txt: Says the Congressional Budget Office "is expecting a protracted economic malaise for at least the next decade under current policies."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in a web post:
quote_txt: Says there were over 600 reports of Texas votes for Donald Trump in the state’s 2016 Republican primary virtually all getting tallied for Marco Rubio.

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Team Trump has accused Ted Cruz of fraud" in Iowa, Texas, Colorado, Oklahoma, Louisiana, Kansas, Maine, Utah and Wisconsin."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "The largest U.S. companies would owe $620 billion in U.S. taxes on the cash they store in tax havens."

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2016 in a press release:
quote_txt: "For the votes that we got, I think we spent, on average, two bucks a pop. Compared to 42 bucks" for incumbent Milwaukee County Executive Chris Abele.

description_txt: stated on April 28, 2016 in a conference.:
quote_txt: States with "the highest gun ownership rates also have the highest suicide rates."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2016 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton voted "for virtually every trade agreement that has cost the workers of this country millions of jobs."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2016 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Polls show "Hillary Clinton wins every time with Donald Trump" as her opponent.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • April 10, 2016

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Rhode Island: 3% bigger at low tide."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Charlotte’s anti-discrimination ordinance would have "opened all bathrooms to all sexes at all times" if it hadn’t been overturned.

description_txt: stated on March 9, 2016 in an interview on NPR:
quote_txt: Says 80 journalists have been killed in Mexico in the last decade.

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2016 in a debate:
quote_txt: "It’s clear" that Hillary Clinton "violated national security laws."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2016 in a CNN interview:
quote_txt: Says Bernie Sanders "wants higher standards for toy guns than real guns."

description_txt: stated on April 7, 2016 in during a campaign stop in Philadelphia:
quote_txt: "Because of (the 1994 crime bill), we had a 25-year low in crime, a 33-year low in the murder rate, and listen to this, because of that and the background check law, a 46-year low in the deaths of people of gun violence."

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2016 in a plan on his campaign website:
quote_txt: Mexico receives "approximately $24 billion a year in remittances from Mexican nationals working in the United States. The majority of that amount comes from illegal aliens."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2016 in a statement on his campaign website:
quote_txt: Race to the Top grants "require participating states to adopt the Common Core standards as a condition for receiving federal funding."

description_txt: stated on April 3, 2016 in an interview:
quote_txt: "There are no rules governing" the 2016 Republican convention, "the rules have not been set."
